resources.string: GoldMine is a game developed by an awesome student group at NTNU in 2012.

The goal of the game is to score as many points as possible. By clicking a cell with gold you get points and by clicking a cell with a mine you lose points. The number with a gold color indicates the amount of adjacent gold cells this cell has and the grey number indicates how many adjacent mines this cell has. The game ends when there is no more cells with gold.

In GoldMine mode your objective is to score as many points as possible by finding and clicking the cells containing gold and avoiding the cells containing mines. The golden number indicates how many adjacent gold cells this cell has. The grey number indicates how many adjacent mines this cell has. Players take turn and the one with the highest score when there is no more gold left is the winner. Every time you click a gold cell you get an extra click. Good luck!

In Pure Gold Mode your objective is to score as many points as possible by finding and clicking the cells containing gold. The golden number in each cell indicates how many adjacent gold cells this cell has. Players take turn and the one with the highest score when there is no more gold left is the winner. Every time you find gold you get an extra click. Good luck!
